column10:
1) During this mission, Aiko is introduced as the final team member.
2) Together with Mugen, she will infiltrate a monastery and rescue Takuma from captivity.
3) We learn that Mugen and Aiko are very fond of each other. This starts the buildup for when he betrays the Shogun to save Aiko.
4) We reunite with Takuma, and learn a bit about what happened to him after the war.
Mugen arrives at the monastery. A mysterious woman appears out of nowhere. It is Aiko, the fourth team member.
EN
column12: Simplified Chinese

column10: Mount Tsuru
column12: 鹤山

column9: worried because he doesn't see Aiko
column10: Hmm ... is there a chance I got here first? Did she not get my message?
column12: 嗯……怎么没人？难道她没收到我的消息？

column10: Konnichiwa, Mugen-san.
column12: 午安，无限大哥。

column10: Ah, Aiko-san. Your beauty is most welcome on this desolate mountain.
column12: 哦喔，爱子小姐！在这荒山野岭还能一睹您的芳容，真是三生有幸。

column10: Mugen-san! Have we come all this way for flattery?
column12: 无限大哥。跑到这种荒郊野外，就为了来献殷勤的吗？

column10: I wish it were so. You seem to have arrived before me. What do you gather from this place?
column12: 我倒希望如此。看来你比我先到。有没有探到什么情报？

column10: The guards are talkative. I heard them speak of a captive held near the waterfalls.
column12: 这边的守卫都很健谈。我听他们在说有个俘虏关押在瀑布那边。

column10: That must be Takuma-san! How shall we proceed?
column12: 肯定是琢磨大师！你有什么计划？

column10: There are a number of female temple servants. If we find a match, I can take her clothes and assume her identity.
column12: 寺庙里有不少女佣。如能拿到合适的衣服，我可以乔装成女佣。

column10: It would allow me to move freely and ring the bell that calls the monks to prayer …
column12: 这样我就能进出自由，然后敲响大钟，召集僧人去祷告……

column10: … thinning out the crowd. An elegant plan. One of the many things I have missed about you.
column12: 调虎离山，然后趁机潜入…… 此计甚妙，爱子小姐还是和当年一样才貌双全。

column10: Very well. Once we reach Takuma-san, we should …
column12: 很好。一旦救出琢磨大师……

column10: Quickly! Someone is coming!
column12: 躲好！有人来了！

column10: I expect you to make up for the loss of the latest shipment.
column12: 你们要将功补过，弥补上批货物的损失。

column10: Yes, Lord Yabu. The monks will increase their workload, as will Takuma.
column12: 遵命，薮大人。我会让僧人和琢磨都加班加点。

column10: This matter will soon be concluded, and the old man will cease to be useful. See to it that he never leaves this mountain.
column12: 最后一批货很快就能造完，那么老家伙就没用了。到时候切记不能让他活着下山。

column10: As you wish, Yabu-sama.
column12: 谨遵指令，薮大人。

column10: And make sure that the next transport leaves in time. I will not tolerate any further delays.
column12: 下批货一定要准时发出。不可再有拖延。

column9: Samurai bows, heads back to temple
column10: That was close. Best we start now, before more complications arrive.
column12: 好险。迟则生变，我们最好立即行动。

column10: Lord Yabu. I expect we will meet again in the near future. For now, we must free Takuma-san.
column12: 薮大名，我们很快就会再见面的。但现在要先营救琢磨大师。

column10: So Lord Yabu has forced Takuma-san and the monks to build weapons. We will deal with him once we have freed Takuma-san.
column12: 看来是薮大名强迫琢磨大师和僧人们制造武器。这次先营救琢磨大师，下次再去找他。

column10: I agree, let us begin.
column12: 同意，开始行动吧。

column10: An officer is annoyed by how slow the bridge is being repaired.
column12: An officer is annoyed by how slow the bridge is being repaired.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: This one must reach Kyoto, understand?
column12: 这批货一定要安全运到京都，明白吗？

column10: Then take a different route!
column12: 那就换条路走！

column10: You must protect these crates with your life.
column12: 就算搭上性命也得保护好这批货。

column10: If  you fail, Lord Yabu will have your head.
column12: 要是办砸了，当心薮大人要你脑袋。

column10: No excuses, no delays.
column12: 别找借口！不得拖延！

column10: The team reaches the monastery walls.
column12: The team reaches the monastery walls.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: These wagons … I have seen their kind before. This place is indeed the source of the weapon transports.
column12: 这些马车…和我之前见过的一样。此地的确就是武器运输的源头。

column10: The gate they came from is heavily guarded, but there are other ways in. Let's explore the possibilities.
column12: 大门戒备森严，但还有其它方法进入。先打探下周围吧。

column10: Aiko climbs a vine to get inside the monastery
column12: Aiko climbs a vine to get inside the monastery

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: I will go ahead. Will you be patient while I am gone?
column12: 我先走一步啦，你会耐心等我回来吗？

column10: The sight of your elegant ascent will keep my thoughts occupied.
column12: 你攀爬的背影实在优雅，在下都看呆了。就让我在原地好好回味吧。

column10: The team interacts with a crane statue. A secret passage opens. (This  dialog only triggers before Takuma has been freed)
column12: The team interacts with a crane statue. A secret passage opens. (This  dialog only triggers before Takuma has been freed)

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: Curious. This opened a secret passage of sorts. Let us keep that in mind for when we leave.
column12: 好神奇。这个机关能打开秘道，撤离的时候或许能派上用场。

column10: What is this? It seems to have opened a secret passage. We must remember that for our escape.
column12: 这是什么？这个机关好像能打开秘道。最好记下来，逃离的时候用得到。

column10: Aiko infiltrates the entrance area
column12: Aiko infiltrates the entrance area

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: Carts and wagons, packed with firearms. What an unexpected place for such a sinister enterprise.
column12: 嗯…这么多装满火器的推车和马车。谁能想到堂堂庙宇之上，竟有这等勾当。

column10: Aiko infiltrates the pilgrims area
column12: Aiko infiltrates the pilgrims area

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: There are more guards than monks and pilgrims combined. Clearly the gods are not masters of this temple …
column12: 僧人和信众加起来都没守卫多。这座庙里，供奉的哪是神明……

column10: A guard asks for guidance at a shrine. He then approaches a temple servant. She denies him, and he returns to the shrine. Repeat …
column12: A guard asks for guidance at a shrine. He then approaches a temple servant. She denies him, and he returns to the shrine. Repeat …

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: What should I do …
column12: 我该怎么办…

column10: Uhm … I … hello again …
column12: 嗯…那个…我还是想…

column10: I beg you. Leave me be.
column12: 求你了，别来找我了。

column10: Give me strength …
column12: 大神，赐予我勇气吧…

column10: Uhm … would you … consider …
column12: 呃…那个…我想…

column10: Please. It is forbidden.
column12: 别这样！不可以的。

column10: Aiko sees a temple servant she can steal clothes from. All guards in the area frequently glance at the girl.
column12: Aiko sees a temple servant she can steal clothes from. All guards in the area frequently glance at the girl.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: This woman has a few secret admirers. Her uniform would fit me perfectly.
column12: 好像有不少人对这个女佣有意思嘛。她的衣服正合我身。

column10: Temple servants launder clothes
column12: Temple servants launder clothes

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: Hmm …
Almost done.
column12: 快干完了。

column10: There …
column12: 嘿！

column10: This needs mending.
column12: 这件得缝一下。

column10: Aiko has reached the laundry, where a few temple servants are busy washing and peging out clothes.
column12: Aiko has reached the laundry, where a few temple servants are busy washing and peging out clothes.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: The laundry. What better place to look for new attire?
column12: 是洗衣场。要找衣服，来这里就对了。

column10: Aiko has just received her temple servant disguise.
column12: Aiko has just received her temple servant disguise.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: Once I have changed clothes, the guards will not suspect me.
column12: 换上这身衣服，守卫就不会怀疑我了。

column10: Aiko has put on her temple servant disguise.
column12: Aiko has put on her temple servant disguise.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: It has been some time since I have worn Hakama.
column12: 已经很久没穿过这种女袴了。

column10: Now I must proceed to ring the bell. Once the monks have gone to prayer it will be easier to bring Mugen-san inside.
column12: 得去敲钟了。如果僧人都去祷告，无限大哥就更容易进来。

column10: Aiko passes by an impressive staircase that leads to the inner temple.
column12: Aiko passes by an impressive staircase that leads to the inner temple.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: Layers of walls, fortified gates ... this was once an armed temple. No wonder they have the means to produce weapons.
column12: 真是高墙林立，关卡重重…...这座寺庙曾在战时武装成据点，难怪会选这里生产武器。

column10: Aiko passes by a graveyard tended by temple servants.
column12: Aiko passes by a graveyard tended by temple servants.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: A graveyard. Former servants of this temple. I always find these sorts of places soothing.
column12: 墓地。葬在这里的应该都是庙里的人。这种地方总能让人心神宁静。

column10: Aiko find tunnels that lead to different parts of the temple.
column12: Aiko find tunnels that lead to different parts of the temple.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: Tunnels. Do they lead to the different parts of the temple? What a curious place this is.
column12: 有隧道，是连通寺庙其它地点的吗？这里的构造真是稀奇。

column10: Aiko approaches the bell that calls the monks in for prayer.
column12: Aiko approaches the bell that calls the monks in for prayer.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: The bell. I hope the monks do not mind a change in routine.
column12: 钟在这里。希望大家不要察觉今日的祷告时间和平时不一样。

column10:
Aiko has rung the bell and cleared the way for Mugen.
(block if Mugen has already entered)
column12: Aiko has rung the bell and cleared the way for Mugen.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: The path is clear. I should return to the entrance and help Mugen-san in.
column12: 路已开好，现在该回到入口，帮无限大哥进来。

column10: Mugen enters the monastery.
column12: Mugen enters the monastery.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: I'm in the temple. What is your impression so far, Aiko-san?
column12: 我已进入寺庙。你在庙中有什么发现吗，爱子小姐？

column10: This place hides many things. It must have a rich history.
column12: 此地藏了不少秘密，必有很多渊源。

column10: We could look for records to satisfy your curiosity.
column12: 文献里没有记载，不过我们可以一起去找找。

column9: always finds Mugen's honest support charming
column10: You mean well Mugen, but I think we have more urgent business to attend to.
column12: 无限大哥说笑了。还是赶紧办正事吧。

column10: Mugen discovers large rocks that he can lift and throw on people.
column12: Mugen discovers large rocks that he can lift and throw on people.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: These rocks might prove useful. I could throw them on unsuspecting opponents.
column12: 这些岩石说不定有用。可以悄悄扔到敌人头上，给他们来个惊喜。

column10: I am eager to hear the stories surrounding this particular battle strategy.
column12: 我很好奇，你每次用这个战术的时候，结果如何。

column10: On the way to Takuma, Mugen observes Aiko as she kills a man.
column12: On the way to Takuma, Mugen observes Aiko as she kills a man.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: Your deadliness rivals that of Hayato-san.
column12: 你的身手和隼人兄不相上下啊。

column10: Is that your Shinobi friend? I am looking forward to making his acquaintance.
column12: 是说你提过的忍者朋友吗?我期待与他相识。

column10: Perhaps you and he can trade stories regarding your training and experience.
column12: 没准你们还可以交流切磋下技术。

column10: A Shinobi from Iga and a Kunoichi from Shinano. It will be quite the exchange, I'm sure.
column12: 伊贺忍者和信浓女忍交流切磋么。应该会很有收获吧。

column10: I wonder if he's worked with other Kunoichi before. From what you told me he seems a solitary person.
column12: 不知道他有没有和女忍一起行动过。你口中的他，似乎是位独行客。

column10: When Mugen reaches the waterfall.
column12: When Mugen reaches the waterfall.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: There's the waterfall. Takuma-san must be close.
column12: 看到瀑布了。琢磨大师一定在这附近。

column10: From what you have told me, he enabled your victory in Osaka Castle.
column12: 据你所说，攻下大阪城也有他的功劳。

column10: We could not have done it without him. I never thought I would get the chance to thank him.
column12: 没有他我们不可能获胜。没想到事隔多年我还有机会当面感谢他。

column10: We will both thank him, once we have freed him.
column12: 救出来之后，我们一同感谢他吧。

column10: When Mugen reaches the waterfall.
column12: When Mugen reaches the waterfall.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: Samurai guard this area.
column12: 此地有武士看守。

column10: Samurai ... they can see through my disguise. I should keep my distance.
column12: 武士……他们能识破我的伪装。我得离他们远点。

column10: An officer is annoyed by how slow the bridge is being repaired.
column12: An officer is annoyed by how slow the bridge is being repaired.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: No more excuses, old man.
column12: 不准再找借口，老头。

column10: Hmm, we are doing what we can.
column12: 唔，我已竭尽所能。

column10: Lord Yabu demands results.
column12: 薮大人要你拿出点成果。

column10: Hmm, of course he does.
column12: 嗯，那肯定的。

column10: When will the next shipment be ready?
column12: 下批货什么时候能备好？

column10: Hmm, when it is finished, I presume.
column12: 唔，该好的时候自然就好了吧。

column10: Will it take longer than expected?
column12: 工期难道要延长吗？

column10: Hmm, an excellent question.
column12: 啊，这个问题问得好。

column10: Are you mocking me?
column12: 你是在耍我吗?

column10: Hehe, what makes you think that?
column12: 呵呵呵，何出此言?

column10: Do not test my patience!
column12: 别把我逼急了!

column10: Hmm, I shall follow your advice.
column12: 嗯，你说得是。

column10: Takuma is arguing with the samurai who guards him. Mugen sneaks up on them and cuts the samurai down.
column12: Takuma is arguing with the samurai who guards him. Mugen sneaks up on them and cuts the samurai down.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column9: waits briefly after Mugen has killed the samurai
column10: … Hehe, good thing you came. His conversation went nowhere.
column12: 哈哈！来得正好。和他说话简直是对牛弹琴。

column10: Takuma-san. My name is Ōshiro Mugen. Do you remember me?
column12: 琢磨大师，在下尾城无限。还记得我吗?

column10: Hmm … hehe how could I forget? You were with the young Shinobi, at the siege of Osaka.
column12: 嗯…我怎会忘记呢？是在大阪攻城战的时候吧，你和一个年轻忍者一起。

column9: notices that Takuma has a wooden leg
column10: We have come to free you. I understand Lord Yabu forced you to build firearms here?
column12: 我们是来救你的。听说薮大名强迫你在这里制造火器？

column10: He was quite keen on my knowledge. I had to instruct the monks, whom he enslaved to produce weapons in large numbers.
column12: 他觊觎我的学问。这些僧人也都是被他奴役的， 我被迫教他们大批量制造火器。

column10: Hrm … Lord Yabu will pay for this.
column12: 哼，我无限一定要让薮大名为此付出代价。

column10: Might we continue this tale later? The monks might finish their prayer soon, and it is a long way back to the entrance.
column12: 待会儿再聊吧？僧人的祷告可能快做完了，而且逃出去的路还很长。

column10: Hehe, yes, we should listen to your companion, Mugen.
column12: 嘿嘿，是的，你的同伴言之有理。

column10: Directly after Rescue Dialog
column12: Directly after Rescue Dialog

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: Hmm, on your way here, have you passed by any statues of cranes?
column12: 嗯，你们来的路上，可否经过一些仙鹤雕像？

column10: Why do you ask?
column12: 问这个干什么？

column10: This is an old place, with old secrets. Let me mark these statues on your map … if we inspect them, who knows what we might find …
column12: 此地历史悠久，藏了很多古代秘密。我会把这些仙鹤雕像的位置标于地图之上。如能前去调查一番，或许会有意外收获……

column10: We have seen them, and noticed they open secret passages.
column12: 看到过，好像是打开密道的机关。

column10: I suspected as much. I'm sure some of them lead off this mountain. Here, let me mark the statues on your map.
column12: 果然如此，其中应该有能直接下山的通道，让我来把仙鹤雕像的位置都标到地图上吧。

column10: When Takuma passes the waterfall on the way out.
column12: When Takuma passes the waterfall on the way out.

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: Hrm … too slow.
column12: 哎……走不快啊。

column10: I am sorry about your leg Takuma-san.
column12: 琢磨大师，对于你的腿我深表遗憾。

column10: Oh don't be, I escaped death that day. A wise man does not question fate after fortune gave him a smile.
column12: 哦，不要在意。那日我也算死里逃生了。所谓大难不死，必有后福。

column10: Your wooden leg has been crafted with care. Did you fashion it yourself?
column12: 你的木腿制作精良。是你亲手做的吗？

column10: Indeed, it has served me well. Though I have been making some improvements.
column12: 是的，用着还挺顺的。另外，我还在上面做了些小改造。

column10: Near the exit
column12: Near the exit

column10: EN
column12: EN2

column10: Oh, I will not miss this place.
column12: 哦，终于可以和这里说永别了。

column10: I am curious. What are your plans, now that you are a free man?
column12: 冒昧地问一句。既然自由了，接下来有什么打算呢?

column10: Hmm, I had no desire to support Lord Yabu's ambitions. But I will gladly help you end them.
column12: 之前我是迫于无奈才助纣为虐的，但现在我很乐意帮你们挫败薮大名的野心。

column10: I will not ask the impossible of you.
column12: 不能再让您老以身涉险了。

column10: Heh, do not fear, Mugen-san. With the proper tools, even an old fool like me can be of use on the battlefield.
column12: 呵呵呵，别担心，无限。若有利器在身，我这样的老糊涂亦可在战场上有所作为。

column10: You are a man of many talents, Takuma-san.
column12: 琢磨大师还真是文武双全，神通广大。

column10: Oh, too many, I'm afraid. Heh, most bring me nothing but trouble.
column12: 神通是不少，但有用的不多，反而一堆麻烦，呵呵呵。

column10: Well then, let us return to the safe house and discuss the fate of Lord Yabu.
column12: 那么，先回藏身处，再商讨如何处置薮大名吧。

column10: MISSION-WORDCOUNT EN:
